intro: Gerascanthus fissistylus, commonly known as the African bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, and its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer. Gerascanthus fissistylus is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and botanical collections.
